Reviews.Title: “excellant stay”
Reviews.Author: Margaret B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights and found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful at all times day and night. The entire establishment was very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I had read a few bad reviews and saw bad photos but I believe they were for a different place, as this one was spotless. I will be going back. Margaret Booth

Reviews.Title: “if you need internet better stay away”
Reviews.Author: cindy g
Reviews.Content: The WiFi internet is almost nonexistant. It takes forever to load any page you want to go to. My smartphone was much faster. Shame I needed to enter work which I could not enter from my smart phone. Took me 5 times as long as it should have because I had to wait and wait and wait and wait for the stupid page to work. do not recommend. will not stay here again. Oh yes and I killed a ROACH that was crawling up the wall

Reviews.Title: “great staff and i'd recommend staying here!”
Reviews.Author: nadznadz_11
Reviews.Content: the staff were extremely helpful through out our stay. the room was clean and good value for money. breakfast was nice, waffles, cereal and coffee were available. unfortunately, the location of the motel was not ideal. in a taxi it was approximately 20 minutes away from beale street, and the local area was considered rough. the pool was also closed throughout our stay, and considering there was little to do in the local area this was disappointing. all in all a good motel but not the best location.

Reviews.Title: “OK except for one important thing”
Reviews.Author: unmoroinblues
Reviews.Content: I would have given three stars as the room and bathroom were clean and big, couch, table, desk and TV, internet and coffee maker. Unfortunately, the sheets weren't clean enough, as shades of old stains were visible in different places and I didn't feel confortable. The location is probably convenient for those who are just passing and stopping by, pretty close to the airport but far from anything else. Located on a kind of highway there are no shops and restaurant on walking distance, so you'd need a car. There are two or three vending machines in the lobby, but water was sold out and hasn't been supplied during my two days stay. However the staff was kind and helpful. The breakfast very basic. I think most of the customers are passing travelers and lorry drivers. It was very cheap, but, as I didn't have a car, I spent what i saved in taxis. If just as me you don't have a car and you are interested in visiting Graceland and/or the city centre I would recommend to stay downtown (Beale street). Consider that if you intend to visit the SUN Studios (walking distance from Beale St.) you can get a free ride from there to Graceland and return (check the website http://www.sunstudio.com/).

Reviews.Title: “Work Not Holiday”
Reviews.Author: THORP-10
Reviews.Content: First of all could I say that the hotel itself was fine for a budget stop, the managers and staff were very helpfull and the breakfast was good for a free continetal afair. The problem is this is not a hoiliday location so as 4 adults who were in Memphis to see the sights it was a $35 taxi ride to everywhere. As was pointed out to us from day one it was not advisable to walk anywhere after dark so you do need a car or taxi. After saying that we saw no trouble or problems and the other guests and visitors were very freindly and helpfull. The bottom line is if you are staying as a stopover and have a car you get exactly what it says on the tin a cost effective freindly motel, if you are there on holiday get one of the posh downtown hotels and pay that bit extra. Finaly could I thank the manager and his family for there help during our stay as he was as suprised as us to have a group of tourists staying for a week with no idea about anything. Geof Thorp, U/K.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place at a decent price with AAA discount.”
Reviews.Author: jgladieux
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews of the place I was a little concerned, upon arrival I found the location to be fairly clean looking on both the outside and inside. The old barbed wire fence I had read about was replaced by a nice fence, my room was decent with the only problem I had was the TV in my room was going bad and reception was kind of poor (not a clear picture on any channel). The location appears to be in an industrial area with trains running but if you get an inside room you shouldn't have a problem with trains and street noise. Internet service was ok running about 1.3 mbps. I had no problem with my room other than the previously mentioned TV problem. I didn't feel that there was a personal safety issue but I didn't really roam around in the evening. The desk staff I dealt with was friendly and I had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “"just chill...."”
Reviews.Author: EHMM
Reviews.Content: My mother and I were on a vacation through the south, we started out in Memphis. I had booked 2 week nights at Harrahâ€™s in Tunica and did not want to pay their Saturday rate. So, I figured that since it was our first night in and we would be getting in rather late I decided to pick a nice and cheap hotel. Well, cheap is right! The location to the attractions in Memphis is close, but on the â€œwrong side of the tracks". There is not much around but some run down buildings, but the hotel does come with fence and barbed-wire. Upon check in we were a little nervous about the location, but went through with it. We were shown to our room and upon closer inspection I noticed not only were there hair on the bathroom floor (eek!) and the drain stopper was on the counter, there was not a smoke detector. Well I found that pesky smoke detector; it was hiding in the drawer (and with NO battery). On our way out to dinner the man at the front desk asked how everything was, I politely smiled and said "well the smoke detector needs a new batteryâ€� he replied with "why? Is it making noise?" I said "No, itâ€™s in the drawer and has NO battery at all". He smiled back and kindly said "Well, what are you to do?â€� He was right... what are you to do? You would think it would be to get a battery, but who am I to judge? It was quite during the day, but we did get to listen to wonderfully loud rap music coming from the apartments behind the hotel. The toilet did not stop running after being flushed, which made for a fun evening of playing in a hotel's toilet tank!! And I also have to mention the billboards in the area... they consist of sayings like "Don't buy guns for people who can't, or you will spend 10 years in jail", " The security door store" and my personal favorite, "Beat a woman and your a punk forever, Just chill...don't kill" On the positive side... The beds were fairly comfy and the room was nice. The location was not very far from the main attractions. The breakfast was very nice and filling. Oh yes, and the price was just right!

Reviews.Title: “Better a crack house than here”
Reviews.Author: droberts01748
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. If it wasn't filthy or broken, it was about to break or fall down. The place was a total dump. Walking around my room barefoot turned my feet black! Of 7 chairs in the pool area, every one of them was broken in some way. You couldn't see your toes in a 3 foot deep pool. Doors didn't work. Phones didn't work. I expected far better for a chain motel. Of three hotels I stayed in on my last vacation this was awful. It was the chintziest most pathetic breakfast bar ever with only a single gallon of orange juice and milk provided for the entire hotel of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great for it's price”
Reviews.Author: TnGovols
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a couple of nights and the staff was very, very, very friendly. Romos were in a good shape and I didn't have to worry about things not working in the room. Internet was really fast; surprisingly for hotels. Overall I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “~Horrible Location~ Fear for your life terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: Queenoftrble16
Reviews.Content: I will never go back , 1st things first I'm a super 8 employee I booked my reservation before my husband and I went to memphis, thinking we would have a great time celebrating my 23rd birthday .. It was far from great It was Terrifying! I spent the entire 1 day and a half there scared for my life ! The room was old and disgusting, I wouldn't be surprised if someone had died there and there was barbed wire all the way around the building for protection if that tells you anything. I booked 2 nights and even though I told the manager I was scared for my life and left the 2nd day I was Still charged for 2 nights ! Poor Management and very poor neighboorhood I will never go to Memphis, TN again !Do Not stay here !For your own health and well being!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: IowaLove2Travel
Reviews.Content: We booked this motel thinking that it would be ok for the price. We didn't want to spend a lot on a motel that we wouldn't be at much of the time. We was pleasantly surprised! The motel was nice, though the rooms could use a little updating, it was clean and comfortable. The pool was clean. What impressed us the most was the staff. They were the nicest and most helpful people! Helped with directions, advised of the best places to eat, thinks to see, and told stories of growing up around Elvis! Great experience, would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: lmullet
Reviews.Content: Nice pool for "catching some rays." This motel was pretty much what you can expect for a $55 room. The wireless internet is very fast and reliable, in fact I submitting this review from my room. If you're looking for a cheap room for one night, this place fits the bill.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Memphis Airport East
HotelInfo.Address: 4060 Lamar Avenue, Hwy 240 to Lamar Ave S, Memphis, TN 38118
